alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Davie (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:08AM EST until January 12 at 4:07AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Yadkin River At Yadkin College affecting Davie and Davidson Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yadkin River at Yadkin College. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, The river is at bankfull. At 18.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. There is flooding of mainly farmlands on both banks. At 21.0 feet, Lower level campsites at the Thousand Trails Preserve off US-64 begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 20.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM EST Wednesday was 20.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.8 feet on 01/26/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Sun Yadkin River Yadkin Colleg 18.0 20.6 Wed 9 am EST 21.7 4.7 3.1 3.1 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1015 PM EST.
